title: Emmy Awards 2021: What to Expect and How to Watch; Shows from HBO Max, Disney+, Netflix and Apple TV+ are among the most nominated
text:
Below are when and how to watch, a list of which shows got the most nominations and everything else you need to know about the ceremony.

When are the 2021 Emmys?

The Emmys ceremony will air Sunday, Sept. 19, at 8 p.m. ET on CBS. It will be held at an outdoor space at the L.A. Live entertainment complex, near the Microsoft Theater, where the show was originally scheduled to take place.

Who is hosting the 2021 Emmys?

The Emmys will be hosted by Cedric the Entertainer, a stand-up comedian known for the "Barbershop" and "Madagascar" movies. This will be Cedric the Entertainer's first time hosting the Emmys. Jimmy Kimmel hosted last year's Emmy awards, which mixed virtual and in-person proceedings.

How can I watch the Emmy Awards?

The Emmys will air on CBS and viewers also will be able to stream the ceremony live and on demand on Paramount+, the network's streaming platform.

Who got the most Emmy nominations?

Disney+'s "The Mandalorian" tied Netflix's "The Crown" for the most nominations at 24. "WandaVision," also on Disney+, earned 23. Apple TV+'s "Ted Lasso," meanwhile, got 20 nominations, the most ever for a comedy in its first year.

Other programs that landed a large number of nominations include "The Handmaid's Tale," which got 21; "The Queen's Gambit," which earned 18; and "Mare of Easttown," which got 16. "Lovecraft Country," which was canceled earlier this year after its first season, got 18.

HBO Max, which launched in 2020, received nominations for comedies "Hacks" and "The Flight Attendant." HBO and HBO Max led all other platforms with 130 total nominations, followed by Netflix with 129 nominations, Disney+ with 71 and NBC with 46.

To read more about who else was nominated, see our guide to nominees in major categories.

What at the Creative Arts Emmys?

The Creative Arts Emmys was a preliminary ceremony, held Sept. 11 and 12, honoring more technical categories, such as cinematography and stunt coordination.

Emmy Awards 2021: What to Expect and How to Watch
